5.97.text:
- My portfolio is ideally a greatest hits
of stuff that I've done,

10.99.text:
so most of my portfolio is based on
the best documentation I have

16.98.text:
- Getting good quality documentation is one of
the biggest challenges I have faced as an artist,

22.15.text:
and I have a lot of work that's gone undocumented,
to be honest,

26.03.text:
and it used to be--
artistically, that used to not bother me at all

29.63.text: because I make very ephemeral work,

31.51.text:
and it felt appropriate that it would happen
and then be gone.

34.46.text:
But it's true that
that is the only archive you have

37.84.text:
to show a funder or to show someone
who's interested in your work.

41.96.text:
- One of the things that I wrestle with
in my studio practice

45.10.text:
is how to represent
all of the various things that I do,

49.39.text: and to create multiple bodies of work is important

53.55.text: because it helps distinguish one from the other,

55.69.text:
and then those various portfolios are ones
that I would apply for grants with

61.19.text:
or to be juried into shows
or galleries,

64.65.text:
and it's nice to have multiple bodies of work
in order to do different things.

70.22.text:
- I use a couple different portfolios
for the different things I do.

73.68.text:
One is for performance,
and another is for soundtrack and theater-type music.

79.22.text: The performance portfolio is more extensive,

83.32.text:
and that includes some tracks that can be listened to,
some videos,

87.68.text: and it includes a press kit.

89.92.text: And most of this is electronic,

91.95.text:
but there are people that still want to have
paper in their hands.

95.13.text:
So I do have a folder that I send out,
if it's requested,

101.74.text:
- I refresh the elements of my portfolio
whether it's my resume or my--the works themselves,

108.85.text: almost with every application that I create,

111.62.text:
and I tend to tailor it for whatever it is
that I'm applying for,

116.42.text:
and so I pull different works in
depending on what I think will work best

123.14.text: - I don't update my portfolio often enough,

126.22.text:
but I do try to update it
when a landmark has been reached.

130.46.text: If I've recently won some kind of an award

133.46.text:
or I've done some kind of a big important gig
or opportunity,

138.14.text:
I just go in there,
and I update that information.

141.67.text: - Often, a lot of the work and jobs that I get

144.61.text:
come from face-to-face encounters
and random contacts like that,

148.44.text:
but it's really good to be able to
back up my presence or personal connection

153.60.text:
with a strong argument
in a portfolio that's visual.
